Tali was on her spaceship, doing some research on what planet has the most population and what it is like to live there. She wanted to go on exploring and see the sights of what other people do on that planet. Since her spaceship can talk to her, they said planet earth has the good resource for her species to live on. Tali soon thinks about it for a second before she decided to go on for a search and see what planet earth is like.

"Okay, Take me to planet earth." Tali had command her spaceship and soon they warp speed to planet earth..

Once they were there, the spaceship said "Complete and we are by planet Earth, Tali".

Tali looked out of her window and see no planet at all near them. She wanted to be sure we are here and that everything is fine. The spaceship made no errors at all and that they are by planet Earth. Then Tali decided she would looked around outside of her ship and to find planet earth.

Once she is outside she found...

11113222.content:
Tali goes back inside after finding nothing outside the ship. However, before she did that, she doesn't notice the new small object that is on her chest.

Seconds, for Tali, minutes for the planet, ago...

The people of earth were doing their normal lives. That change immediately when they heard a sonic boom in space. Everyone crane their neck to look up, but found something that was impossible to to describe. All they see is something metallic. That also quickly change when a hissing and bright light start to appeared, soon to be replace by something purple. The people scream in panic as a purple rubber like wall that covers the sky was heading towards them. Armies around the world fire nuclear missile at the wall, only for it too do nothing to the wall as it continues its course. Luckily for the planet, the wall stop a mere mile from it before collision. However, the mass of this strange force is so massive, that it had a sense of gravity itself, easily dwarfing Earth's gravity and thus pulling the planet to it. The bottom of the planet soon made contact to the surface of this galaxy like being until the people felt the strong force as the being start to move.

Back at Tali's point of view.

"I don't see anything, are you sure there is supposed to be a planet here?" Tali ask her AI.

"That strange, let me scan the area again." The AI uses its scanner in search of Earth within its radius. After a minute, the AI spoke.

Tali then look in space one more time before heading back to her ship and begin walking to her room.

1111322222112.content:
"Out of the things you want me to do, you ask for that?" Tali says with a small chuckle. "Then again..." she looks around her room. It was a little messy, mostly from her not cleaning the ship for few months. "A little cleaning isn't a bad thing. Keep searching for any planet that has life form, the quarian fleet said one should be in this system."

"Will do....actually...." Tali was about to start cleaning up when the AI stop her a bit. The AI spots something bury within Tali's chest. It was Earth, but unfortunately for everyone in the world, the AI mistaken the planet for something else. "Seems you have a pebble within you chest."

"Oh?" Tali looks at a mirror and does indeed spot something. "Well you look at that..." Tali says as she reaches for it.


To the people of Earth, the voice above has rung their ears off to the point that they could be actually deaf. However, losing their ears was the least of the problem as a dark shadow cast over them. Everyone looks up and screams in fear as massive landscape came right down and pinches the planet, desttoying most of the continents on the world. Soon the world shakes as the planet rose from its squishy prison until a purple bright light shines upon it. The light was nothing more than the eyes of Tali looking the planet through her mask. Everyone in the world and panics as the alien goddess stares at them, preying she sees them and is saving them. Unfortunately that wasn't the case as the landscapes, that were Tali's finger, immediately press together, immediately reducing the planet and its inhabitants in nothing but dust.

"Must've had the thing on me when i look outside." Tali says, after crushing the "pebble" into nothing. Oh how little does Tali know of what she has done as she wipes her hands on her hips. Earth is destroy by a oblivious alien, and now the only humans are the hundread that has survive the carpet, only to be face with a grimmer trial ahead of them. "Enough of that, let's get cleaning." Tali says as she makes her way to a supply closet to pick some cleaning utensils.

Many of the people got scatter when Tali woke up, and none of them know of the terrible fate of their homeworld. Some were scatter through out the carpet, some on Tali's bed, and some even landed on Tali's desk, where a microscope is place as well. Will all of them survive, or will only one will live or wilp none shall survive Tali? Who can tell as the alien goddes herself is coming back.

1113.content:
Tali'zorah nar rayya was on her pilgrimage. However unlike most Quarians whom could finish their pilgrimage by just buying a new shuttle, some spare ship parts, among any other number of things, that would be of use to the fleet. She had to stick to a higher standard, for she was not only one of the brightest Quarians to ever live, but also the daughter of one of the admirals, therefore in order to end her pilgrimage she would have to bring back something big, something life changing...

After working for 2 years in different ships as a mechanic, tali was finally able to save enough money to buy a small busted up ship, that should be in a junkyard, however thanks to her expertise, she was able to patch it up enough to make it space worthy, which was enough for what she needed it. during her pilgrimage Tali started to research possible ways to increase the efficiency and power of mass effect powered FTL, that if successful would allow the ships of the quarian fleet to travel using only a small fraction of their fuel, not to mention that it will also allow them to go explore further regions without having to use the mass relays. so after running simulations and designing an engine that increases the potency of Ezo along with boosting its effects, she made the proper adjustments to her ship and was ready to try it out.

So here she is now in her ship, ready to try out her experimental engine. After making sure all her systems were ok she fired up her FTL engines. at first everything seemed to be working just fine, and according to the ships computer, the adjustments she made to the ships engines were working just as she had hoped. Tali was elated that her hard work had, 'as the humans say "Bore fruits". she was cheering and jumping on her sit, happy as can be, until her ship Shook violently, almost throwing her off the sit. she managed to recompose herself and immediately checked her ships computer. what she saw made her turn pale. apparently a sun along the route she had set had released a massive concentrated solar flare as her ship was speeding by. the radiation expelled from the flare in turn, short circuited some of the engines systems and caused an anomaly withing the Ezo core, that was in turn making the engines leak an unknown type of radiation throughout the ship.

Before Tali could get out of her sit and head for engineering, the ship started shaking violently. Tali looked up at her computer screen and saw that the radiation was making her ship go far faster than ever recorded and the anomaly in the Ezo core was encompassing the entire ship now. from the readings her computer were giving her, she could infer that whatever was happening to her ship, it was giving off the same energy readings of a wormhole.

Just as Tali was about to try to get up again, her ship became engulfed by a bright light unlike anything she has ever seen. next thing she knows her ship came out of FTL right above the orbit of a garden planet. Tali tried to sit upright but then her engine exploded and shook the ship so violently, that Tali's sit buckle came undone and she ended hitting her head hard against the ceiling of the cockpit. her vision started blackening. there was nothing she could except watch as everything was been encompassed in darkness. But just before the darkness swallowed everything, she could see the garden world getting bigger....at that moment her only thought was*Keelah... I knew I should have bought a newer ship instead of this piece of bosh'tet'. a second later she knew no more.

112.content:
Ahsoka felt alone. After quitting the Jedi counsel due to the false accusations that were made against her. She's just been wondering the galaxy, alone. Alone and bored, she has no idea what she will do. she currently has no purpose. She's just been helping people wherever she can. Right now Ahsoka was in her ship flying around the deepest part of the Outer Rim. Ahsoka sees that her fuel tank is getting low and decides to go to the nearest planet "Hopefully I'm not that far out" Ahsoka said knowing that there are plenty of planets out there still not familiar with intergalactic space travel.

She steps out of her ship and looks around. Amazed at the beauty she saw. The sky was bright blue and the landscape was pure green. This planet would be perfect to live. If only the planet itself was a lot bigger "Hello is anyone here" Ahsoka said as she walked around

Unknown to Ahsoka someone was around. A farmer who was taking care of his fields and cattle. At least he was until he heard a deafening sound which spook all his cows causing them to run around "Stupid kids playing pranks" the farmer said to himself. He thought it was just kids until he saw the sun get blocked out and a shadow fell across the land. He looks up and was scared beyond belief as a giant brown object of death and pain coming his way. He tries to run but it is beyond pointless as the giant brown object squished him, his house, his family and all his cattle"

"Guess no one lives here" Ahsoka said to herself unaware of the murder she just committed. Ahsoka looks into the distance and see a weird area of grey "Guess I'll check that out" Ahsoka said as her curiosity got the better of her. And with that she walked towards it

Now which situation will you take this story.

One
Two
Or Three
112.title: Mile High Ahsoka

choices: A actual city filled with humans
1123.content:
As the gigantic Togruta slowly continued her descend through this strange really,really tiny blue-green planet she had no idea where or when she was

"Where in the name of the Force am I? This is the oddest planet I've ever been on?" Ahsoka thought out loud as she glanced curiously around even with her perfect eyesight she could barely see anything then again if she could she might be able to see nothing but miles of freshly green countryside,fields of corn and grain and farmhouses and barns scattered here and there.

"How odd none of this is coming up on any of my readings!" The former Jedi Padawan learner observed as she studied the palm held device at her side yet as slowly as she was taking her time with every single step she took regardless to how gentle she caused untold and unfolded destruction her brown boots left enormous footprints in the dirt flattening entire fields and farmhouses and shook the surrounding land for miles luckily the frightened occupations already saw the massive shadow which blocked out the sun itself descending upon them like a being from the heavens and ran for it.

Ashoka was totally unaware of this at all even with all her extraordinary training with the Force she was seemly unable to detect any type of life forms running for their very lives beneath her feet even the cattle and horses sensed something was very wrong and practically broke through the heavy fences,barn doors etc to safety in a panic.

"I still have no idea where in the Republic I am! I only hope I'm not causing anyone harm!" She thought as she slowly continued onwards but stopped suddenly once she saw a sight for sore eyes:something that really sparked her attention

"Ohhh what is that....." She wondered what she was staring at was.....

President and Ahsoka talk it ends poorly Ahsoka and the U.S. go to war
11231.content:
Ahsoka took two steps forward before falling on her knees, unknowingly causing disastious earthquakes and ripping the land apart. Something caught her eye, something shining with the raise of the sun. Fluffy white material surrounded her face, clouding her vision, so not being aware of the consequences Ahsoka puckered her lips and blew the fluffy material away, not knowing that, that fluffy material were clouds.
Down below in the small city, the micro citizens look up at the gigantic face they could barley comprehend, some of the citizens were able to see that this giant wasn’t a giant at all, but a giantess that was 1000’s of miles tall. They did not run, nobody moved a muscle, every man woman and child did nothing but stare up in awe at the goddess that descended from the stars. Suddenly the ground beneath everbodies feet jumped up, and the whole city shook from a disasterious earthquake, to some it was the greatest earthquake they had ever felt. Concrete And building walls started to crack and break open and every glass window in the whole city broke. Nobody knew that this all happened simply because the giantess Ahsoka was getting on her knees. To every bodies horror the giant face got even more gigantic as Ahsoka brought her face even closer. To everyone’s surprise they saw the giantess lips start to move, to pucker. By the time everyone knew what was happening it was to late. Raging winds started the overwhelm the whole city, winds stronger than any class 5 hurrican, buildings started to tumble and fall, and people who where exposed on the street where sent flying 100’s if not 1000’s of feet in the air, many died on impact with the ground, the extremely lucky ones would not ever move again, for their nerves were damaged without hope of ever recovering.
Ahsoka saw that the small shiny object barley even the size of a inch to her started to tumble and fall. Black fumes started to ascend up to her face, fumes coming from the tiny object. Ahsoka knew these fumes well from her days fighting on the front lines. It was “smoke!” Ahsoka said with a surprised voice. All of a sudden Ahsoka put her hand on her head, as if she was having a headache. “A disturbance in the force.” Ahsoka said confused. At that moment Ahsoka new something was wrong, someone, no a lot of people died just recently, but where? Ahsoka looked at the tiny object. “No it couldn’t be”. Ahsoka said with doubt, but she had to be sure. Ahsoka calming herself down and breathing concentrated on the force and reached out toward the small object with her feeling. She saw it, buldings on fire, the ground ripped apart, men women and children on the ground laying dead or crippled. She heard it, the screams of thousand of people as they ran in fear, or the screams of people trapped in the fallen buildings, and the cries of thousands of people, crying over their lost loved ones. Ahsoka opens her eyes in shock. “Oh no what have I done.” Ahsoka said, but before she could do anything she sees something coming towards her, something flying towards her face, something, tiner than a Grain of sand. Little did she know that this was a helicopter and inside was the president of the United States.

1143.title: female WayBig

choices: 100 miles (Big enough to cover a city with her foot)
11431.content:
Earth had been under the rule of the Incurseans for quite some time now. With the raw power of the titanic mutated To'kustars under the control of the Incursean empire, they had seized control of the earth in a matter of hours. But this was about to change. Our hero, the young Benjamin Tennyson, had returned from hiding to wrest control of his home planet back from the slimy Incursean emperor.

Our hero had been fighting the mutant To'kustars (or "waybads" as he nicknamed them) for some time now. currently, he was fighting one-on-one with a female waybad. This was the first one he had seen back when the invasion of the incursions started. Ben hated to admit it, but she was putting up one hell of a fight. Ben was the better fighter but a combination of his fatigue and her wild strength meant they were on almost even footing. The evenness of the brawl lasted until Ben finally landed a good hit on the waybad. She blocked with her arm, but the hit was so strong that it caused her to fall backward. When the hit landed, an audible crunch sound was heard, not the sound of a broken bone, but more like hitting a cell phone with a hammer. Ben had neither the time to notice or care, he pressed his advantage and kept up the fight with his adversary.

From his grounded warship, Lord Emperor Milleous was watching the fight unfold. With every hit Ben landed his patience grew thinner. "That's enough!" the Incersean commander bellowed. "Psychobos, I thought you said the To'kustars were under your control! Why haven't you sent any more at him?" Dr. Psychobos hesitated, knowing that his Employer would not like his answer. "Well, you see, every To'kustar in the immediate vicinity, aside from the one fighting, is incapacitated. Bu-" "Incapacitated? You said yourself that these mutants would be more than enough power to keep control of earth! I don't enjoy being lied to, Psychobos." The alien scientist knew that with how well Ben was fighting and how mad Milleous was getting that it was time to use his last resort plan. "Well, Lord Emperor Milleous, there is a weapon in our arsenal that we can use to permanently destroy that hero, and I use the term loosely." "Well, why haven't you used it yet?" "You see, to power it, we must take all the energy from the mutant To'kustars using a device I planted on each and every one of them. So, powering the weapon will render every To'kustar... useless afterward." "Then do it! Anything that'll get rid of that annoying Tennyson kid."

Ben had his opponent on the ropes, despite the fact that she was fighting with the fury of a wild bull. Ben prepared to finish his opponent when his attention was stolen by mysterious purple wisps floating through the air. The To'kustar stopped to look as well. It didn't take either of them long to realize that the wisps were coming out of the mouths of the fallen To'kustars, and all heading in the same direction. The waybad saw this as something threatening her kin, so her instincts directed her to follow the odd purple wisps. "Hey, we weren't done here!" Ben shouted after her. The waybad ignored him and kept her attention on the wisps. Ben decided to follow them too. There was no one left to fight, and something was clearly going on.

Both of them arrived at the Incursean warship, seeing the wisps travel into some sort of glass-like sphere filled with purple energy on the outside of the ship, which was clearly connected to a worryingly large gun. The Incursean emperor and mad scientist inside grinned ear to ear noticing that Ben walked right to them just as the weapon was almost charged. Not only that, but one of the waybads was with him, and she could hold him in place for an easy shot. But...wait. she was walking towards the ship. To the capacitor, in fact. Dr. Psychobos pounded on the manual controls, but she wasn't stopping. She attacked the glass orb with all of her might, truly believing that she could free her kin by doing so. Ben saw her swinging at the ship and decided not to question her abrupt change of heart. Ben joined in on the pummeling of the warship, focusing more on the gun.

After dozens and dozens of strikes, the capacitor was almost broken. The incursions tried to send fighter ships to bring down the two to'kustars, but it proved ineffective. Ben just swatted them away, and the waybad carried on as if nothing was happening. Suddenly, with one last well-placed strike, the glass sphere burst open. A large hole was left in the ship, and Ben was knocked onto his back. However, the one who took the blast directly was the waybad, but it did not harm her. She had mistaken the wisps as the souls of the other To'kustars. They were actually the energy and power of the To'kustars focused into a small area. She had just been hit with the raw power of all the mutant To'kustars on the planet, and she absorbed every last drop. The sudden energy caused her to almost instantly blackout.

After a few short minutes, the To'kustar woke up. Her head felt a bit fuzzy, but she managed to sit up. She looked at her surroundings and noticed they were... different in some way. The reason it looked different was that she had grown to impossibly huge proportions due to absorbing the combined power of all the To'kustars on earth. All of this energy made her grow to a staggering size of...
11431.title: A way WAY big girl.

choices: Everything. Being this big, I should rule the whole planet, shouldn't I?
114311.content:
Waybad rubbed her eyes and looked at her surroundings. Everything was really flat save for a few small bumps. The ground was covered by what she thought was grass that was cut very low to the ground. Upon closer inspection, she could see grey patches and lines here and there. Waybad stood up to get a better look. She saw the land turn to water some ways away to the left and right, but up and down went on long enough that she could only see land. It was an odd place, to say the least.

Back on the ground, Ben had also recovered from the blast. He stared up to the sky in disbelief, the waybad which once matched his height stretched far up into the sky. Just looking up at her made him dizzy. A familiar beeping sound played and Ben transformed from waybig back to his normal human form. He looked up again, now significantly shorter. "Wow, that didn't even make a difference. Just how big did she get?" "Ben!" A familiar shout came from behind him. The voice belonged to his grandfather, Max Tennyson. "We need to get back to the plumber's base. We can't fight that thing right now, not even with waybig." "You don't have to tell me twice." Ben retreated with his grandfather, hoping to find some way to deal with this new threat.

Waybad decided to investigate one of these small grey patches on the ground, getting on her hands and knees to get a closer look. They weren't just grey parts of the landscape, there were rectangular bits rising up from the ground, and many of them were grey. Were they odd rock formations? No, these were too geometric. They looked like the buildings from the city she was in before. Then it clicked for her. That WAS the city she was in before. It had the same layout, the same structures, the only thing that was different was... well, the size of it. Waybad was confused about how it happened, but she now knew she must be absolutely massive...and she kinda liked it. She relished in the power she got from being the size of a building, but now the buildings were the size of bugs. How small would the humans be to her now, she wondered. Her eyes fell to a large green object at the edge of the city. After a moment, she recognized it. It was the warship of the incurseans, the army that had forcefully conscripted and mutated her and her people, then stole their spirits to charge some weapon. She simply could not let such an awful structure stand. Waybad stood up to her full height and slipped her right foot out of its boot. She cautiously lowered it onto the green warship, taking care not to step on anything else, she was only after the ship... for now. Every Incursean on the ship was still recovering from the blast, which damaged a portion of the ship. That would soon become the least of their worries as a massive toe descended from the sky and crushed the ship completely flat without even being slowed down by the largest war vehicle built by the incursean empire. She smirked at her handiwork and returned her foot to her boot.

Ben paced back and forth trying to come up with something, anything that he could do to fight the super-sized waybad. "it's a wonder that she hasn't just destroyed everything. The waybads seemed to love that pastime." His grandfather offered his thoughts. "Well, our guys monitoring the situation said that she did destroy the incursean warship, which was that tremor from earlier, but she seemed to be careful not to touch anything else." "So, what? You think she doesn't want to destroy everything?" "It's possible. If she can target something specific instead of just wildly destroying things then she might have mentally returned to a point before her mutation when she was capable of higher thought. If so, maybe we can reason with her." "How can we reason with her when she's that big? There's no way she could hear us." Max thought for a moment. "We do have one option. A while ago, the plumbers got their hands on the prototype of a large ship meant for advertising at space stations and repurposed it so it could be used as a city-wide warning system. It's got a screen that's almost as wide as a mile and speakers so loud a whole city could hear it. We should be able to use that."

Waybad was lounging around, lying on her back. she didn't crush any cities, but she was certainly blocking many highways. The humans on the ground that were on said highways saw an impossibly high wall of grey flesh if they were lucky, and got crushed under that wall if they weren't. Waybad was thinking of what she should do now that she was even bigger than before. She had already destroyed the incurseans, now she was thinking about taking a dip in the ocean. She was chuckling to herself thinking about walking in and the water only being as deep as a wading pool. Her attention was taken by a quiet voice to her right, she turned her head and saw a small object in the air. It was a spaceship with a screen facing towards her displaying an old human in a red shirt with a flower pattern. The man spoke to her. "My name is Magister Maxwell Tennyson of the plumbers. on behalf of the earth, I would ask what your intentions are here. Waybad smirked. "Now, why would I need to tell a bug what my intentions are, hm?" An additional voice came from the ship's speakers, but they were off-screen. "Woah, woah. Not cool." "Who was that. Hey, you. Guy who just spoke. Show yourself." Ben stepped into frame confidently, feeling a lot braver now that the screen made her look closer to his size. "Oh, hey. You were that guy I was fighting earlier today. Ben 10, the famous protector of earth. Hey, we never did finish our fight. Want I rematch? I bet you I'd win." Ben knew she would, so he changed the subject to something that would hurt his ego less. "Just tell us what you want, c'mon." "What I want? That's simple. I want...
114311.title: 100 miles

1143111.content:
"Me? What do you mean you want me?" "Exactly what it sounds like, Ben. You put up a good fight, and I think you'd be fun to play with. So I want you to come out here and let me toy with you a bit." "Yeah, that's not gonna happen." "oh, that's too bad. I guess I'll just have to stomp on that little city of yours to entertain myself. instead" Ben hesitated "you can't be serious. You'd destroy an entire city just for amusement?" "Well, when you're this big most things become inconsequential and boring. Things need to be on a grand scale to amuse me even a little given how tiny they all are. But you're special, Ben. You amuse me without being a life-ending disaster. So let me play with you, and I'll leave the city be." Ben thought for a moment, trying to come up with an alternative of some sort. But there was none. The waybad had him in checkmate, so he made the only heroic decision he could. "Fine, I'll do what you want." "Excellent. Come to the east end of that little city of yours and make sure you turn into waybig. Otherwise, you might just be too small to see." Waybad giggled at this.

Ben had arrived where Waybad had asked him to go, about as ready as he could ever be for something like this. "Well, here we go, I suppose." He said scrolling through the options on the omnitrix. He stopped when he reached waybig and pressed the button. Ben was now as large as he could get, and he waited for Waybad to arrive. After only a short amount of time, he heard a booming noise and felt the ground shake beneath him. The tremors were rhythmic, and he could tell they were Waybad's footsteps. A shadow was cast over him. He knew what he'd see when he looked up, but he knew he had to. When he craned his head up to the sky, his vision was almost completely filled by the face of the Waybad, grinning ear to ear. "glad you could make it, little hero. Here, climb up on my finger and we can have some fun." Waybad lowered her hand to the ground, it was the size of a small city by itself. her pinky finger was extended and it was clear what she wanted Ben to do. Though it was her smallest finger laid flat on the ground, it was still significantly larger than Ben. He still thought he could get to the top. He got a small running start and used all the strength that came with his To'kustar form to leap as high as he could. He managed to grab the upper part of her pinky finger, though he still had to pull himself up. It took him a while, but he managed to get up to the top. The whole time this was happening, Waybad was watching. She was amused at how much effort it took Ben to climb to the top of one of the smallest points of her body. She found it adorable.

Once Ben was safe atop her finger she slowly rose it up to her face. "Wow, you're so tiny. It makes you like cute, Ben. Ooh! Hey, why don't you turn back to your human form and I'll see if you're still visible?" Ben reluctantly complied and turned back to his normal form. After his transformation back to a human Waybad lost track of him. She squinted and brought her hand closer to her face, making Ben feel quite insignificant. "Now where did you go, little guy?" She said as she scanned her multi-mile wide hand for her new toy. Her eyes finally landed on a small speck, something she would've never seen if she hadn't been looking for it. "Oh, I think I found you. You look like a little dot on my hand. Now, what to do with you?" She thinks for a moment before settling on...
1143111.title: You, Ben.

11431112.content:
Waybad gets a devilish grin on her face. The grin took up all of Ben's line of sight. He really didn't like the look of it. Suddenly, Ben feels the ground underneath him tilt as Waybad turns her hand forward. Ben plummeted downward at great speeds. Instinctively, he reached for his omnitrix, figuring he could dial in jetray or something before he hit the ground since Waybad was holding him up and he was, therefore, dozens of miles in the air. He didn't have enough time to select anything, as he soon landed in a big, soft area that surrounded him on all sides. He was dropped between Waybad's breasts. Waybad, giggling happily, layed back down on the same spot she lounged at before. All of the highways she laid on were closed off at this point, her very presence causing great disruptions to millions of commuters.

Ben wriggled his way out of his squishy prison to the point where he could poke his head out of the Waybad's cleavage. His respite was short-lived, as Waybad quickly began squeezing her sizeable bosoms together. Ben resisted at first but eventually couldn't resist the amazing full-body massage he was getting. He was beginning to warm up to the idea of this "toy" thing. "Haha. Are you enjoying yourself, Ben?" She didn't wait for a reply, she just kept mashing her multi-mile diameter breasts together. Ben was so small that she couldn't even feel him, but she knew he was there, which excited her greatly. The greatest hero in the universe was trapped between her massive funbags, and she could do whatever she wanted to the microscopic hero.

After an amazing few minutes of breast hugging, waybad thought of a couple of ways to spice things up. She stopped her squishing for a moment and pulled her cleavage open a bit. Though he was too tiny to be seen, Ben was right between the two large orbs of flesh, in the greatest state of euphoria he had ever felt. "Hey, Ben. I want to have a talk with you. Can you transform to get up to my ear and talk, or something?" "Ben heard her loud and clear, and he had a better idea than that. He still had access to the advertisement ship. He could access it with his omnitrix the same way he talked to other plumber communicators. The large ship flew next to the massive To'kustar's face. "Hey, Waybad! Over here!" Waybad turned her head, she saw the face of her new cute toy on the screen of that ship from before. "Oh, Ben! Good idea! Hey, while you're here. How were my tits? Amazing, right?" "Yeah, absolutely" Ben blurted out. This made Waybad giggle. "Well, since you loved them so much, I was thinking of some ways to take it further, and I wanted to give you the option of which you would prefer." "Oh, nice. Well, what did you have in mind?" "Hmmm... How about...

123.title: Option three

info.brief_description: Giga size giantess aliens has invade, but for what?
info.description:
Earth, or what made up planet you can come up with, was a having a normal day. That all change when a massive ship, bigger than anything the civilization can comprehend, lands on the world. Before anyone could do anything, earthquake began to rumble as something was coming out. As the door opens, out came a giantess alien woman, so large that her height goes above the clouds. What does this woman want?

You basically play either someone in the planet or the giantess.

Scenario:
1) for science: the alien woman is here to examine the land and its inhabitants, however, only sees nothing but strange gray moss beneath her feet. She still decides to take some samples and examine them.

2) Need a new home: that Alien is here to build a new home, either for herself or her people. Despite the sheer size difference of her being larger than the land, she takes alot of the land to make her new home.

3)Conquer or Savior or Destroyer?: The alien appears to be holding a strange banter. Is she here to take this planet for a kingdom? Is she here to save the planet from a much greater threat? Or is she here to destroy the world, viva on purpose or by accident?

4)custom

Aliens woman:

1)Tali (mass effect)

2) Ahsoka (star wars)

3) Cosmo (sonic x)

4)any other fictional character

5)OC (please be descriptive when making your original character)

Size: 100 miles or bigger

Rules: no scat or pee or anything disgusting, no futa, and no male giants. Also, fiction characters has to be alien by nature, meaning no humans as the giantess, anthro or furry does count, but just barely.

That being said, have fun.
